thread.title: CNN’s Brian Stelter: Trump’s Attacks on the Press Are ‘Verbal Form of Poison’
thread.title_full: CNN’s Brian Stelter: Trump’s Attacks on the Press Are ‘Verbal Form of Poison’

author: Josh Feldman
title: CNN’s Brian Stelter: Trump’s Attacks on the Press Are ‘Verbal Form of Poison’
text:
CNN’s Brian Stelter: Trump’s Attacks on the Press Are ‘Verbal Form of Poison’  21   
CNN’s Brian Stelter kicked off today’s Reliable Sources by criticizing not just   media the “enemy,” but his overall attacks on the press. 
Stelter said, “Poison. That’s what it is. It’s a verbal form of poison.” 
He said this might just be words and not actions, but “some of his actions are about the media” and they have an impact on the general public. 
Stelter even brought up the Nixon comparisons people have drawn––given how the late president once called the press the enemy too––and spoke to Carl Bernstein about that comparison. 
And if anything, Bernstein argued, Trump’s attacks on the press are “more treacherous” than Richard Nixon ‘s.
